page.title: 0612 RSME REGIMENT
page.content: 18 Support Squadron looks after all the military personnel and their families who live and work at Chattenden.It is also responsible for all the heavy plant used by the Plant, Roads and Airfields wing at Wainscott. 24 Squadron provides all the soldiers to carry out the work eg. building and dismantling bridges for the training courses. The Workshop Squadron based at Wainscott is responsible for the repair and maintainance of all the equipment used by 12 RSME. There are more than 500 soldiers and 300 civilians working at Chattenden. This does not include the hundreds of students who pass through the School each year on courses lasting from one week up to 18 months. The barracks and training areas cover some 1250 acres. There are also 2 ranges by the Thames.
